title: AFL WAG Rebecca Judd reveals what she won't post online
text:
She speaks candidly about her personal life on her KIIS radio show, the 3pm Pick-up.

But AFL WAG Rebecca Judd said she draws the line when it comes to sharing certain aspects of her life on social media, in an interview with The House of Wellness this week.

The 36-year-old explained how she keeps her relationship with husband Chris Judd private, and is also cautious on what she posts of the couple's four young children.

'We don't need to put it all over social media': AFL WAG Rebecca Judd, 36, revealed what she won't post online, in an interview with The House of Wellness on Sunday

'I don't do a lot of couple stuff with Chris as we keep that private and tell each other we love each other - we don't need to put it all over social media,' Rebecca said.

'There is also a certain amount of privacy and security when posting about the kids, and I always like them to look like kids,' the TV presenter added.

Rebecca wed retired AFL captain Chris, 36, in 2010, and the couple share four children, son Oscar, eight, daughter Billie, five, and twin sons Tom and Darcy, three.

Boundaries: 'I don't do a lot of couple stuff with (husband) Chris (pictured) as we keep that private and tell each other we love each other,' Rebecca explained

In an interview with the Sydney Morning Herald in May, Rebecca said the split of her parents Kerry Brown and Hugh Twigley made her 'absolutely determined to keep it together' with Chris.

Rebecca's parents split when she was four, and so she lived with her mother, stepdad and sister Kate Twigley the majority of the time.

She would stay with her father and stepmother during school holidays.

Family: The TV presenter said she also limits what she posts of her four young children shared with Chris. Pictured with Chris, 36, son Oscar, eight, daughter Billie, five, and twin sons Tom and Darcy, three

'The kids have seen it in other kids' parents or heard about it, or seen it on TV, and think it's kind of normal, which it is really,' Rebecca explained to the Sydney Morning Herald.

'But I have said to them [her children] we will never, ever, ever break up,' she continued.

In December last year, Rebecca shared a black and white photo of herself and Chris in their family home, to Instagram on their eighth wedding anniversary.

'Eight years married today. 15 years together. Four kids later. And a double shot lattè in bed every morning. Lucky me,' the Jaggad co-founder captioned the shot.
description: AFL WAG Rebecca Judd, 36, said she draws the line on sharing certain aspects of her life on social media, in an interview with The House of Wellness this week.
authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
